benchmark_details.name: V ACT (Video Automatic Causal Testing)
benchmark_details.overview: V ACT is an automated framework for modeling, evaluating, and measuring the causal understanding of video generation models (VGMs) in real-world scenarios. It combines causal analysis techniques with language model assistance to assess model behaviors without human intervention.
benchmark_details.data_type: causal testing scenarios and video data

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: The primary objective of the benchmark is to systematically evaluate the causal learning capabilities of video generation models.

data.source: 60 causal systems generated through automatic means, validated through crowd experiments.
data.annotation: Automatically generated using a language model and validated through crowd-sourced human annotations.

methodology.calculation: Metrics are computed based on the ratio of correct outcomes produced by video generation models against the expected causal outcomes.
methodology.interpretation: Higher scores indicate better causal understanding and alignment with real-world expectations.
methodology.validation: Validation through human comparison against automatically generated causal systems.

ethical_and_legal_considerations.privacy_and_anonymity: Privacy measures ensured by not using identifiable personal data in the generated scenarios.
